text:
The Yankee Stadium, at River Ave. and 157th Street, Bronx, is the scene of various athletic contests. The foot-ball game shown here has attracted a capacity crowd. These three views show the field, the stands and several celebrities.

About 1936
Views 1,2 and 3

View 1: Neg.# 999
View 3: Neg.# 1000

About 1936
Views 1,2 and 3

View 1: Neg.# 999
View 3: Neg.# 1000

East 157th Street (foreground), at the N.W. corner of River Ave., showing construction work in progress on part of the Yankee Stadium, American League baseball park. On the right is the elevated structure of the I.R.T. Jerome Ave. subway line, on River Ave.

April 30, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
